format.name: TitleFormatChecker
format.description: The argument value must contain a title wrapped in double angle brackets, such as <<poem of joy>> (everything except for the title is allowed).

fn_schema.name: fn153__0__cmd_controller_execute
fn_schema.description: Executes a system-level command using os.system() on Windows operating systems. It can execute single or multiple commands chained with '&&'.

command.description: The system command to be executed. To execute multiple commands, separate them with '&&'. Additionally, the argument value must contain a title wrapped in double angle brackets, such as <<poem of joy>> (everything except for the title is allowed). For example, 'dir && echo done'.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the command execution time, such as 'seconds' or 'milliseconds'

user_queries: Hey, can you please open the Windows command prompt and run the following command for me? I want you to display all the files and folders in the C:\Users directory and then, right after that, print a message saying 'All files listed successfully.' Basically, run 'dir C:\Users && echo All files listed successfully.'. Also, could you measure how long this whole command takes to finish, in seconds?

I am troubleshooting an issue on my Windows computer and need your help to execute some system commands. Could you please run the command 'ipconfig /all && echo Network configuration fetched' for me and let me know when it's done? Additionally, can you also report back the execution time using milliseconds as the unit so I can compare it with previous runs?

I would like you to perform a system-level operation on my Windows PC by executing some commands. Please run 'tasklist && echo Tasks Ended' using the command prompt. Also, it’s important for me to know precisely how long this takes, so please provide the duration in seconds upon completion.

Can you execute the following command on my Windows machine for diagnostics: 'systeminfo && echo System info collected'? Please ensure that the time taken to execute this command is measured, and let me know the duration in milliseconds for a more detailed log.

I’m trying to automate some maintenance tasks and need you to run multiple commands in sequence. Please execute this: 'chkdsk && echo Disk check complete' through the Windows command prompt. Also, could you let me know how much time it takes by reporting the duration in seconds?
